titleInfo.title: USA v. Kuca
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 13the defendant's Motion to Extend Time as to Daniel Kuca (1). Pretrial motions are due on or before July 2, 2010. The trial of this case remains scheduled to commence beforeJudge Richard G. Kopf. Jury Trial set for 7/12/2010 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 1, Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, NE before Judge Richard G. Kopf. The ends of justice served by granting defendants motion to enlarge time outweigh the interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial, and the additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, the time between todays date and July 2, 2010, shall be deemed excluded in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (MKR)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Kuca
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 15 Motion to Continue Trial as to Daniel Kuca (1). The defendants pretrial motions shall be filed on or before August 2, 2010. Trial of this case is continued pending resolution of any pretrial motions filed. The time between July 2, 2010 and August 2, 2010, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Kuca
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 35 is hereby sustained. Based upon the Forfeiture Allegation of the Indictment and the plea of guilty, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the above-referenced properties. The Defendant's interest in said properties is hereby forfeited to the United States for disposition in accordance with the law, subject to the provisions of 18 U.S.C., § 2253. The aforementioned forfeited properties are to be held by the United States in its secure custody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 18 U.S.C., § 2253, in which all nterests will be addressed. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(AOA)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 35 is hereby sustained. Based upon the Forfeiture Allegation of the Indictment and the plea of guilty, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the above-referenced properties. The Defendant's interest in said properties is hereby forfeited to the United States for disposition in accordance with the law, subject to the provisions of 18 U.S.C., § 2253. The aforementioned forfeited properties are to be held by the United States in its secure custody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 18 U.S.C., § 2253, in which all nterests will be addressed. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(AOA)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Kuca
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report and Addendum as to defendant Daniel Kuca. It is ordered that:... (2)(A)Defendant's objections 40 to the presentence report and specifically paragraphs 13 and 26 predicated upon the assertion that the defendant had little specific knowledge of how "LimeWire" worked and he did not intend to distribute child pornography will be resolved at sentencing.(B)On its own motion, and based upon the factors set for in 18 U.S.C. sec. 3553(a) and the excellent probation officer's recommendation, the Court gives notice that it is contemplating a variance and the imposition of a sentence of 96 months in prison and 5 years of supervised release. (C)The defendant's motion for deviation or variance 41 predicated on the assertion that the Guidelines have no empirical basis, the enhancements attributed to the defendant are arbitrary, and a sentence of 60 months in prison is appropriate considering the sec. 3553(a) factors will be resolved at sentencing.(3)Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report and Addendum as to defendant Daniel Kuca. It is ordered that:... (2)(A)Defendant's objections 40 to the presentence report and specifically paragraphs 13 and 26 predicated upon the assertion that the defendant had little specific knowledge of how "LimeWire" worked and he did not intend to distribute child pornography will be resolved at sentencing.(B)On its own motion, and based upon the factors set for in 18 U.S.C. sec. 3553(a) and the excellent probation officer's recommendation, the Court gives notice that it is contemplating a variance and the imposition of a sentence of 96 months in prison and 5 years of supervised release. (C)The defendant's motion for deviation or variance 41 predicated on the assertion that the Guidelines have no empirical basis, the enhancements attributed to the defendant are arbitrary, and a sentence of 60 months in prison is appropriate considering the sec. 3553(a) factors will be resolved at sentencing.(3)Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Kuca
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order 45 of Forfeiture is hereby sustained as to Daniel Kuca (1). All right, title and interest in and to the properties held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The properties be, and the same hereby are, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(AOA)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order 45 of Forfeiture is hereby sustained as to Daniel Kuca (1). All right, title and interest in and to the properties held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The properties be, and the same hereby are, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(AOA)
